comments:
I have a corrupt plugin with corrupt class file. 

When I try to launch a runtime workbench with this plugin, the platform 
launcher barfs during startup. It does not like class format errors. 

Rather than skip the broken plugin, the platform decides to not start at all. 
This is wrong.

Here is the stack dump that is (luckily) printed to stderr:

This seems to be a decision made by the Workbench application.

The following error occurs using Eclipse 3.0M8 on a Windows 2000 Professional 
platform and JDK 1.4.2_03.  It seems to be related, any suggestions or 
workarounds would be welcome.

!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.util.SecureAction.getFileOutputStream
(SecureAction.java:102)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.defaultadaptor.DefaultLog.openFile
(DefaultLog.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.defaultadaptor.DefaultLog.log
(DefaultLog.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:125)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)

Resolved the NoSuchMethodError reported earlier on Windows 2000 Professional 
platform by editting the System Environment variable setting for "Path" to 
point to the binary folder for JDK 1.4.2_03. Prior to the change it was 
pointing to JDK 1.3.1. Eclipse workbench can now be launched successfully.

What would you expect the workbench to do in this case?  Silently startup
anyway? Should there be an error?
